intro: Mitreola oldenlandioides, commonly known as the Oldenland's mitreola, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its morphology includes a short stem with opposite, fleshy leaves that aid in water retention. The flowers are usually greenish-yellow and are surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
